moves.2... h6: premature.. Bg5 wasn't a threat yet
moves.3. Nc3: Bb4 is a threat to me
moves.4... Bb4: I expected that on the last move, so no problem...
moves.5... O-O: his King is safely tucked away now
moves.6. g3: I'll put by white bishop on the long diagonal before castling
moves.7... d6: he adds protection for the e5 pawn and opens a path for his bishop
moves.8. a3: I decide it's time to run off the bishop
moves.8... Bxc3: he wants to trade (they almost always do!)
moves.9. Bxc3: so I trade knight for bishop
moves.10... Re8: he adds pressure to the d and e files
moves.11. Qb3: I feign an attack on a weak pawn
moves.11... b6: he moves it to a safer square
moves.13... Qe7: is he planning d4, followed by an attack on b4?
moves.14. Nh4: I'll mess with his unprotected bishop...
moves.15. e3: it occurred to me that had he played Bg4 and followed it up with e4, I could have had problems
moves.16... Rxa1: he wants to up the ante...
moves.19. Nxg5: I nab a pawn and unleash a discovered attack on an unprotected knight!
moves.19... hxg5: he either didn't notice or didn't mind losing a pawn in the trade, so he takes the knight
moves.20... Bxd3: I see, he regains the pawn anyway...
moves.22. Bxf7+: but I'll still come out a pawn up ;)
moves.22... Qxf7: now we trade the lost bishops..
moves.24... Nd2: ad then he attacks my queen! The nerve!
moves.25. Qe2: I'm expecting Nf3 , but get a suprise.
moves.26. Bc3: now my bishop is under attack, so I move him to a safe square
moves.26... Kg7: time to put the kings in play?
moves.27. f4: I'll need room to get mine out there
moves.28... Kf8: he can't continue because his pawn is pinned
moves.29. fxe5: he moves to safety, so I nab another pawn
moves.29... dxe5: this trade looks to favor me..
moves.30. Bxe5: so I'm willing to trade bishop for knight
moves.31. Qxe5: now it's all pawns and Queens (I need to trade those Queens!)
moves.31... Qc4: he wants to pick off my only queenside pawn
moves.32. Qf4+: I protect by offering a Queen trade
moves.33. gxf4: now it's just a pawn push, 3 on 2, but my King is way back
moves.33... c5: he wants an isolated passed pawn on the queenside
moves.34. bxc5: I oblige... I think I can get over in time
moves.35. Kf2: I start my King for the battle
moves.36. Ke3: I go straight for the pawn
moves.38. h5: I threaten to run past him...
moves.38... c4: he tries his run for a queen
moves.40. h6: but he can't catch me now, and resigns.
